question: What is the APS?
expected_answer: The APS is the alignment and phasing system and one of the subsystems of the TMT. It’s responsible for the alignment of the segments of the primary mirror.

question: What are the main packages in the model?
expected_answer: There are two main parts, the Observatory model managed by the TMT project office (PO) and the model managed by JPL that includes the APS. both are organized using OOSEM that describes operational context, mission, blackbox specification, logical and physical design.

question: What’s the main purpose of the model?
expected_answer: Verification of timing requirements using the behavioral specification of the as-designed system for various operational and calibration procedures.

question: What are the main elements of the APS architecture?
expected_answer: The APS internal components such as PEAS, PIT, Camera, and external systems the APS interacts with such as M1CS, ESW, TCS.

question: What are the main elements capturing the APS behavior?
expected_answer: The state machines and activities of the components of the APS logical design.

question: What requirements are verified by the model?
expected_answer: Alignment of Post-segment exchange, Calibrate M1CS Edge Sensors, Maintenance Alignment, Off-Axis measurement of WFE, Calibrate elevation dependence of M2 and M3, Measurement of Segment Warping Harness Influence Functions.

question: Which activities are included in verification of the Post Segment Exchange?
expected_answer: Coarse Tilt Alignment, Broadband phasing, Offload Sensor Offsets, Correcting rigid body and segment figure, M3 Alignment, Narrowband phasing.

question: In what cases is a new guide star acquired?
expected_answer: A new guide star is acquired when the current one is lost, unsuitable, or moves out of the patrol field, or when observing new star fields or changing observation parameters. This ensures adaptive optics correction is maintained throughout the observation.

question: What’s the maximum misalignment of M1 when offloading sensor offsets?
What are the parts of the APS logical design?
expected_answer: peas - procedure; executive analysis software, beam splitter stage, Stimulus, Pupil Image and Tracking assembly, peas pit tracking, Internal source, shear plate, k-mirror, sh camera

question: What are the states of PEAS?
expected_answer: Fine Tilt Alignment, Initialize Model State for M1CS Sensor Calibration, Initializing, M2 and M3 Gravity Calibration, M3 Alignment, Maintenance Alignment, Maintenance Alignment 1um, Post Segment-Exchange Alignment, Pre-Session Calibration, Pupil Registration, Self Test, StandBy, Taking Off-Axis measurements, Template State, Tracking Reference Point, Warping Harness Influence Function Analysis, Wavefront Calibration
keywords: Initialize Model State for M1CS Sensor Calibration

question: What are the substates of the Post-Segment Exchange Alignment state?
expected_answer: Broadband Phasing 30, Broadband Phasing 100, Broadband Phasing 1000, Coarse Tilt Alignment, Correcting Rigid Body and Segment Figure Iteration 1, Correcting Rigid Body and Segment Figure Iteration 2, M3 Alignment, Narrowband Phasing, Offload Sensor Offsets
keywords: Correcting Rigid Body and Segment Figure Iteration 1
Correcting Rigid Body and Segment Figure Iteration 2

question: What are the interfaces of the APS blackbox specification?
expected_answer: inout PEAS2M1CSOut : TMT::01, PEAS2TCSIn «ProxyPort», PEAS2TCSOut «ProxyPort», PEAS2ESWIn «ProxyPort», PEAS2ESWOut «ProxyPort», PEAS2M1CSIn «ProxyPort», PEAS2CSIn, PEAS2CSOut, APS2UserIn «ProxyPort», APS2UserOut «ProxyPort», GC2ESWIn, GC2ESWOut, GCDataOut

question: What are the use cases of the APS?
expected_answer: Acquisition, Align M1 segments in TT, Align M3, APS Pre-Session Calibration, Broad Band Phasing, Calibrate elevation dependence of M2 and M3, Calibrate M1CS Edge Sensors, Calibration of Camera Pointing Offsets, Collect Reference Beam, M3 Alignment Procedure, Maintenance Alignment, Measurement of segment warping harness influence functions, Narrow Band Phasing, Off-Axis measurements of WFE, Post-Segment Exchange Alignment, Rigid Body and Segment Figure correction, Self Test
keywords: Calibrate elevation dependence of M2 and M3
Measurement of segment warping harness influence functions
Rigid Body and Segment Figure correction

question: What are the structural elements of the APS operational domain?
expected_answer: aPS Mission, maintenance Team, external Environment, external Constraints

question: What other system components does the APS interface with?
expected_answer: APS User,Telescope Control System, M1 Control System, Common Services, Executive Software

question: What are the structural elements of the APS mission?
expected_answer: APS User,Telescope Control System, M1 Control System, Common Services, Executive Software, APS Operational Blackbox Specification JPL

question: What are the verified requirements of the APS?
expected_answer: Peak Power Limit Requirement JPL, On-axis alignment maximum time for Post Segment Exchange JPL, Maintenance Alignment Maximum Time, M3 Alignment Maximum Time, Off-Axis Acquisition Maximum Time, Warping Harness Maximum Time, Self Test Maximum Time, Telescope Pupil Alignment Requirement
keywords: On-axis alignment maximum time for Post Segment Exchange JPL
